title: wrong line number in error msg
body:
by **werner.hattingh**: 
1. What is a short input program that triggers the error?
package main

func bla1() bool {
	return false
}

func bla5() bool {
	false
}

func main() {
	x := bla1()

	x=x
}

2. What is the full compiler output?

[next@next goprot]$ 6g prot.go 
prot.go:15: false not used
[next@next goprot]$ 

3. What version of the compiler are you using?  (Run it with the -V flag.)
[next@next goprot]$ 6g -V
6g version 
[next@next goprot]$ 

new one. pull at least once a day.

I had this in a bigger file and was bit confused by the output.  In the example thee
error is on line 8 but reports it as on the last line of code in the file.
